header.title: UTFPR Movie Club
header.subtitle: Co-founding of a movie club in my high school and continued it through university undergraduation term.

text: Founded in the towel celebration date exhibiting Star Wars: A New Hope and Blade Runner, this club has the goal to be not a simplistic cinema group.
Totally opposed to the Fight Club ideals, the foundation on May 25th 2013 had roots on enabling discussions of the 7th art in an academic environment dominated mainly by exact science stuff.

In a university located in the city of Cornélio Procópio (Brazil), the club fomented around two movie sessions per month in the university amphitheater, normally holding discussions between the academic and city community around the most diverse and contentious topics.

As a co-founder, the contribution for the club was done from the scaffolding to the expansion, mainly due to the network connections the membership team had through 2013 to 2016 term. This meant the creation of a spin-off in Maringá State University (UEM, in portuguese) by one of our ex-members, as well as partnership in some festivals such as CINEURGE.
Roles: Co-founder, designer, manager, keynote speaker.
Tech stack: Photoshop, Illustrator, Social Media.
